intro:
Idiot.

Love Linux, KDE, Qt, Open Source and Free (as speech) software, Python, Pirate Party, ZeroNet and other awesome technologies, ideas, projects and software that respect our rights, freedom, privacy and anonimity.

There is no meaning of life.

Links:
-[ My main ZeroSite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZAlex.bit/)
-[ ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=zalex@zeroid.bit)
-[ ClearNet site](http://zausoft.ru)
-[ E-Mail](mailto:zalex@zausoft.ru)

post.body: Hello ZeroMe!

![Image test](http://zausoft.ru/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/60.png)
(Need image pasting feature)

Have you seen my new [website](http://zausoft.ru) about [PocketMod](http://127.0.0.1:43110/pocketmod.bit)? It is not very informative, but I'll fix it for release.
What do you think, which site is better?
Just found an amazing ZeroSite - [Zatogra](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zatogra.bit/)
Русскоязычные ЗероНетчики, желаете ли вы продолжения [Блокнота Шизофреника](http://127.0.0.1:43110/shiza.zalex.bit/)? Пара идей для размышлений есть, но нужно ли оно вам?
[We don't need a paid Photoshop!](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:14)

@Testset: as I remember, you wanted folding instructions for [PocketMod](http://zausoft.ru).
So, [I'm working on it](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:15).

Just generated a *wonderful* `.onion` domain using [Shallot](https://github.com/katmagic/Shallot): `putin4madxx7h3bl6.onion`
Well, who wants to get a "putin mad" TOR\Onion domain for free? xD

Check out new release of amazing Python IDE - [Spyder 3.0](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder)
`pip install spyder`

Finally I found a program for taking notes that I love:

> [QOwnNotes](http://qownnotes.org) is the open source (GPL) notepad with markdown support and todo list manager for GNU/Linux and Windows, that (optionally) works together with the notes application of ownCloud\Nextcloud.

> You are able to view and edit notes from your mobile device (like with CloudNotes) or by the ownCloud web-service.

> The notes are stored as plain text files and you can sync them with your ownCloud sync client or other software, like Dropbox, Syncthing, Seafile or BitTorrent Sync.
Just registered [yandex.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/yandex.bit) domain :D

The Syberia 3 release was postponed to the first quarter of 2017
D:

Have you watched the cartoon "Mary And Max" (2009)?
If not, try it. And then share your impressions here, I really want to hear your opinion.

I hope this is only a temporary solution of registration by ZeroID (./js/js.all):
`return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroID/request.php"...`
Registration via BM also centralized because there is a script `./publisher-bitmessage/bitmessage.py`, and as I understand it, nofish runs this script to accept incoming requests.

I am checking ZeroMail every day but today suddenly I get some "new" emails that were sent in early October.
O_o

Congratulations!

> Pirate Party of Russia congratulates the Pirate Party of Iceland with success in the last elections to the Parliament. Iceland Pirate Party won 10 seats in parliament, sharing second place with the Left-Green Movement, and became one of the leading political forces in the country. This is the largest representation of "pirates" in parliament among all countries and we are looking forward to the success of our colleagues, we believe that it will positively affect the success of the pirate movement and the Pirate parties will get more credence on the part of society.
> 
> Freedom! Equality! Piracy!

Today I went to the bank to cash out my first scholarship. The bank employee said that I need *government permission* to cash any money from **my** account, since I'm not 18 years old. I have no right to get my money. I need to collect a bunch of references. I need to apply to the guardianship. I need lots of time to stand in queues to collect these documents.
Russia is a country of "great" opportunities.

That's why I love cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, etc.). It's based on math, not on "paper". My wallet isn't dependents on government and banks. I am the **only** owner of my money.
Remember, remember the [fifth of November](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Fawkes_Night)...
Have you seen my [photo album](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zalex.bit/photos/index.html) at [ZAlex.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zalex.bit)? :D
Neo in Russia...
When overlocked Raspberry Pi and forgot about cooling...
**UPD.** openSUSE 42.2 is [available for download](http://opensuse.org/)!

Meanwhile in Russia:
Teachers are forcing students to give scholarship to the University in Belgorod. One blogger has accused the University of corruption, and he is now judged for it. - [Open Russia](http://openrussia.org/post/view/19790/)
How to solve problems with installing [Linux to ThinkPad](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:16)
[Don't open if you're love Apple](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SbmgV7Oyp0w)
How do you spend your winter vacation? :D

[**PineBook**](https://www.pine64.org/?page_id=3707) - Light and Thin 64-bit ARM based **Open Source** Notebook!

The energy-efficient ARM processor with a such powerful battery (**10 000 mAh**) ensures a **really** long life without power.

I'm not a gamer, so it will be enough for my needs. One question - **how** did they achieve such low ($99) price? Now I know how to spend my scholarship! \^o^/

## PocketMod Reloaded - Beta Testing!
*[What is PocketMod?](http://zausoft.ru)*
Well, I need some brave testers!
**1. Download**
[Linux\Source Code](http://zausoft.ru/PocketMod-0.3b.tar.gz)
[Windows\Installer](http://zausoft.ru/PocketMod-0.3b-setup.exe)
**2. Install**
Linux: install dependencies `sudo pip3 install PyQt5 markdown pillow` (some packages are available in repositories, eg. `python3-qt5`), unpack archive, `python3 start.py`
Windows: just run installer
**3. Report**
Write E-Mail to [zalex@zausoft.ru](mailto:zalex@zausoft.ru) with subject `PocketMod Beta-Test` and tell *everything*: what is working, what isn't working, are there any freezes\lags, what you don't like, which plugins would you like to add, any suggestions, etc.
GitHub, PyPI, setup.py, new website - later.
**P.S.** It contains **very-very-very** bad source code.
:D
[NotABug](http://notabug.org/) - really cool GitHib-like code hosting service service, but fully FOSS (Free\Libre) and with private repositories!
[The Right to Read](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/right-to-read.html): A Dystopian Short Story by Richard Stallman
Does anyone know what is the reason for increasing the price of **Litecoin**? About an year Litecoin was worth ~4 USD, but a few days ago it **suddenly** began to grow. Now it's ~9 USD for 1 LTC.

Russia - censorship and surveillance in one package! Just look at this nasty attempt of [MITM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man-in-the-middle_attack). Cryptocurrencies and sites about them (eg. BTC-E) are de facto banned in Russia, although the law doesn't prohibit them.
[Awesome Gamedev](https://notabug.org/Calinou/awesome-gamedev) - a huge collection of **free software** and **free culture resources** for making amazing games.

# Attention!

**Very bad news from ~~totalitarian~~ Russia.** *Dmitry Bogatov* was arrested **because he is the owner of the Tor exit-node**. Links: in [English](https://meduza.io/en/feature/2017/04/10/mathematics-teacher-accused-of-inciting-mass-riots-now-also-accused-of-supporting-terrorism-and-once-again-detained), but a bit outdated info; [more actual article](https://geektimes.ru/post/287944/), but in Russian
**[Dmitry](http://sinsekvu.github.io/pages/about.html)** is the Free software activist and programmer, teacher of mechanics and mathematics, vegetarian and pacifist. Police said that he called people to participate in an opposition rally, **just because of the coincidence of IP addresses.**
This is the first known case of the arrest of the Tor-node operator in Russia.

*Did you know?*
[Two women in Russia are in the prison](https://meduza.io/news/2017/04/11/osuzhdennyh-za-sms-zhitelnits-sochi-pereveli-v-lefortovo) for sending an SMS.
Shortly before the [conflict in South Ossetia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russo-Georgian_War), they were sent SMS messages (to Georgia) about the Russian military equipment that was seen on the railroad. They were charged with treason. One woman was sentenced to 12 years of imprisonment, other for 8 years.

In the Russian Parliament [submitted](https://meduza.io/cards/v-dumu-vnesli-zakonoproekt-o-zhestkom-regulirovanii-sotssetey-ego-primut) a bill to the **full control over the social networks**. they want to make the registration on such sites age-restricted and only on the passport.
Thank you, **ZeroMe**! You're completely independent from our idiotic government.

Russian Parliament introduced another [insane bill](https://meduza.io/cards/kak-vlasti-hotyat-rasshirit-prava-politsii). They want to give the police an awful lot of authority: the inspection of the person, his personal belongings and home; **breaking and entering** in the cars, **houses** and other private property; **shooting at public events (!)** - and all this **without any reason**, if they deem it necessary. **Without orders and permission** of the court.
@nofish: the save button disappears.

Russian opposition activist **Vyacheslav Maltsev [was arrested](https://meduza.io/news/2017/04/13/v-saratove-zaderzhan-politik-vyacheslav-maltsev-ego-kvartiru-vskryli-bolgarkoy)**. His house was broken into and he was taken away in an unknown direction. 

**UPD:** Maltsev [had](https://meduza.io/news/2017/04/13/u-maltseva-sluchilsya-serdechnyy-pristup-posle-zaderzhaniya) a heart attack after the arrest. He can't speak. He was sent to a Moscow hospital by plane.

The situation in Russia is getting worse. After [demonstrations against corruption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Russian_protests), the authorities began mass arrests of protesters, opposition activists and even random people. What does it mean? It means that **corruption is the "core"** of the Russian government.

**I want to know your opinion**. Do you want to continue to read posts about current events "from the trenches"? Does it interesting for you? 
Write comments, please.

The authorities of the Russian region Chechnya [**threatened to kill the journalists**](https://openrussia.org/notes/708479/) of "Novaya Gazeta" because they wrote articles about discrimination against homosexuals and human rights violations.
Also, the head of this region published in social networks photos of the opposition politicians in the crosshairs of the sniper.

It seems that there are no good news from Russia, [only bad](https://meduza.io/feature/2017/04/16/oni-privykli-chto-oni-lyudi-poslednego-sorta-im-etu-mysl-vnushili).
After the mass arrests of homosexuals (about **150-200** people) **several killed**, many were maimed and said about **torture via electric chair**.

> "He shows me his hands and there he has a strange invasive injury. It's not a burn, not a cut. I've never seen anything like this. And it turns out that this *injury from electric current*. They hook up some "clothespins", 220 volts, and these places, where they are attached, affects the most. Now, it looks like this deep eczema that goes into the muscle, I don't even know how to explain it."
Sad that I live in a such horrible country.

[Roskomnadzor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Service_for_Supervision_in_the_Sphere_of_Telecom,_Information_Technologies_and_Mass_Communications) (the Russian Federal Agency responsible for censorship of the Internet) [asked](https://geektimes.ru/post/288166/) VPN providers to block sites that are banned in Russia.

If someone will again talk about the difficulties of working in Free\Libre software, I will remember [this short story](http://bash.im/quote/444461).
> Sometimes using of Open Office is hell. In the Excel, all dates are automatically converted according to the template, but in OOo 31st of Apri is displayed as the full date, not abbreviated. The rest of the dates are converted automatically, but this date is not converted. And if I write 30th day, then everything works. Although, stop. How I got **31st of April? Dammit!..**

**Bad news from my town!** Teachers **forced** me to go for a **militaristic rally**. There was a song with the words "we are for Putin!". I was forcibly brought. I went to the other end of the square, sat on a bench with the Pacific ☮ on clothing. Maybe I'll tell more if I find the video of this event.

Меня, как и многих других студентов, принудительно сняли с пар и пойти на сомнительный митинг милитаристской тематики, где играла песня с припевом "Мы за Путина!". Уйти я не мог, так что, отошёл немного, сел на скамейку и закрепил на одежде Пацифик.

> «Patriotism is, fundamentally, a conviction that a particular country is the best in the world because you were born in it...»
- George Bernard Shaw.

> «Патриотизм — это ваше убеждение, что ваша страна лучше всех остальных только потому, что вы в ней родились...»
- Джордж Бернард Шоу.

[Anti-patriotism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-patriotism) / [Антипатриотизм](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Антипатриотизм)

**Sony PlayStation 4** [was recognized](https://rublacklist.net/27951/) by the Russian customs as **"encryption tool"**. Customs says that the product is an encryption device if it can implement cryptographic algorithms, **regardless of whether it's main purpose or not**. Now the man who ordered PlayStation from Germany will be fined, and his console is confiscated.
**[Polyethylene bio-degradation by caterpillars of the wax moth](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2017.02.060)**

I do not like any kind of psychological tests, because many of them are quite obvious to me. But the ["16 Personalities Test"](https://www.16personalities.com/) surprised me very much. I expected to see in the results obvious things like "phlegmatic, introvert", etc. but I got something much more. I read a lot of things that I did not notice in myself before. Especially about my vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
P.S. I am the [INFJ](https://www.16personalities.com/infj-personality) (“The Advocate”)

Bad news from Russia: Leftist activists and vegans [were detained](https://meduza.io/news/2017/05/01/na-shestvii-v-moskve-zaderzhali-veganov-i-levyh-aktivistov) at demonstrations in Moscow. They passed through the center of the city with the banner "Animals are not food".

Bad news from Russia: The [Roskomnadzor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Service_for_Supervision_in_the_Sphere_of_Telecom%2C_Information_Technologies_and_Mass_Communications) [**began to quietly block the messengers**](https://rublacklist.net/28213/) that refuse to compromise users and cooperate with government. They decided to start with *less popular applications*, but this is just the beginning... Blocked apps: BlackBerry Messenger (BBM), LINE, Imo.im, Vchat. Also, Zello and Linkedin were previously blocked.
My college again forces us to participate in militaristic rallies, under the threat that we won't be allowed to take exams. Damn it.

Meanwhile in Russia, **20th of April**
>xxx: Now I know the only correct answer to the question, why do trees drop leaves for the winter. Because the layer of snow that has settled on the leaves can easily break a tree.
>yyy: And where did you read this?
>xxx: Nowhere. I just looked out the window.
I finally received a coupon for buying a [Pinebook](https://www.pine64.org/?page_id=3707), but *now*... I have absolutely no money for it `._.`

I'm developing a Python\Qt program. How to implement the distribution?
1. Go along the path of ZeroNet - do not integrate with package managers (PIP, etc), store the program itself, settings and plug-ins **in one folder**; make own auto-update module for all operating systems.
2. **Split the code** of the program (eg. /usr/lib/python3/packages/...) **and plug-ins with settings** (home/user/.pocketmod/...), auto-update through the package manager.

So, in any case, I'll have to write an auto-update plug-in (for Windows), and in the second case I also have to do PIP support, setup.py, etc. 
**Is it worth it? What's better?** Also, if you select the second option, then tell me, will there be enough to support the PIP only?
Write comments, please. **I really need your feedback.**

Some major Russian Internet sites were blocked in Ukraine.
A deputy of the Russian parliament [said](https://meduza.io/short/2017/05/16/ukraina-zablokirovala-rossiyskie-sayty-reaktsiya-deputata-gosdumy-idealnaya) just the *"golden words"*:
> In the Internet, prohibitions are silly and irrational, people will somehow find a way to get around them.
P. S. [Internet censorship in Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_censorship_in_Russia)

Feel the quality of *Russian education*. The *physics teacher* in our college claims that *sound does not spread in the water*.
#### FACEPALM.

Russian **federal** TV-channel [recommended](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8YX88pFUmIo) to **eat scraps from the dump** (something like [freeganism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freeganism)). It seems that the government is preparing us for the worst.

*Meanwhile*, the **state oil company** Rosneft [wanted to buy](https://navalny.com/p/5387/) a set of dishes for its helicopter - *tea spoons, forks and knives* (18 pieces of each cutlery) for **$200 apiece**, *ice tongs* for **$650** and plaid for **$2,200**. They decided not to buy it after a well-known oppositionist drew public attention to this contract. By the way, many Russian doctors and teachers will have enough of their salary to buy only *1-2 teaspoons*

The Russian parliament is discussing a [law](https://meduza.io/news/2017/05/24/zakonoproekt-o-zaprete-anonimnosti-v-messendzherah-vnesen-v-gosdumu) that **prohibits anonymity in messengers**. I hope that nofish will soon add DHT support to ZeroNet...

In the capital of Russia, a **10 years old boy was arrested for reading a Hamlet** on the street. Despite the fact that his mother was next to him, the boy was taken away **alone**. [Video](https://www.facebook.com/irina.yatsenko.75/videos/vb.100002394968858/1357948527628300/?type=2&theater)
According to the parents, their son is engaged in theatrical activities and he acts on the street to fight with the complexes.
**UPD:** The child has already been returned to his parents. [More info](https://openrussia.org/notes/709871/)
Well... **My site ([zausoft.ru](http://zausoft.ru)) was blocked in Russia** and now it is inaccessible to everyone. I'll write the details soon. Damn it.

Now I will tell you how my site became blocked in Russia.
1. My site is hosted with a shared IP. Of course, it was much better to order a *dedicated one*, but I do not have much money...
2. There were other sites on this hosting with the same IP. One of these sites was listed in the black list of Russian censorship.
**All other sites on this IP were also blocked...**
3. So, my site was blocked in Russia together with others. The hosting provider later discovered the problem and promptly moved all sites to another IP. But my domain was managed by a *third-party DNS server* and there was no automatic address change. As a result, my site was not available to *everyone* (in the world).

Well, I felt all the injustice of censorship on my own. We have so much unreasonably blocked sites, but even worse that completely innocent people suffer. I understand that it's partly my own fault, but for me sometimes it's better to save money for something more important.

Bad news from Russia. The construction company demolished the house when the owners were not there. The company did not have permission to demolish, they did it arbitrarily. They not only deprived the family of the home, but also brutally killed domestic animals - 5 puppies. [Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1C0dngpzTn8)

Oh, guys... I'm in trouble. The next day will be quite difficult for me. The teacher asked my parents to go to college because I refused to go to military training camps. My pacifist and anti-militaristic views are increasingly turning to me for something bad. Teachers have told me that I will regret that I am a conscientious objector.

Victory! I defended my right to be a [conscientious objector](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscientious_objector) and I was removed from the list of military training camps.
(Photo: "Non-Violence" sculpture)

The last month there are some problems with the opening of different sites in Russia. Owners of blocked sites launched a war against the censorship authority. They register various IP addresses in the DNS of their domains - large social networks, tech-addresses of Roskomnadzor, payment gateways and so on. As a result, many websites suffer, even the government website did not open, because Comodo site was blocked, and their SSL-certificate was issued by this company. Because of problems with payment servers, Russian banks [for a while](https://meduza.io/news/2017/06/09/dyru-v-reestre-roskomnadzora-ispolzovali-protiv-platezhnyh-serverov-rossiyskih-bankov) did not accept plastic cards. The government has already given the name to this method of resistance - "DNS-attack". The situation is heating up...

Hot! Alexey Navalny, the Russian opposition leader, has been arrested. Today he arranged anti-corruption rallies throughout Russia. At the same time, electricity was cut off in his Anti-Corruption Fund, the online broadcast of the rallies was disrupted.
The tear gas was sprayed at the anti-corruption rally in Moscow.

Anti-corruption rallies in Russia:
Policemen beat protesters with batons - [video](https://twitter.com/openrussia_org/status/874254549447520256)

Developing a bot for the [Cursors.io](http://cursors.io/) game. I do this through a fake mouse input for QWebView (Python + Qt) retaining control over the system cursor. I can already write the first letters of the alphabet (on the screenshot). I plan to make a whole army of fake cursors :D

Putin showed to Oliver Stone a video of how Russian aircraft are shelling Syria. [It turned out](https://meduza.io/news/2017/06/20/putin-pokazal-oliveru-stounu-video-kak-rossiyskaya-aviatsiya-obstrelivaet-siriyu-okazalos-chto-eto-amerikantsy-atakuyut-talibov-v-afganistane) that the video shows how the American Apache helicopter attacked the Taliban in Afghanistan in 2009.

### ATTENTION! ACHTUNG!
Google is banned in Russia. *Stay tuned.*
**UPD. After about 3 hours, Google was unblocked**

Some fresh news from Russia:
- Google [was](https://meduza.io/feature/2017/06/22/google-vnezapno-zablokirovali-v-rossii-i-tak-zhe-vnezapno-razblokirovali-chto) banned in Russia for 3 hours
- The head of Roskomnadzor (Russian censorship authority) [said](https://meduza.io/news/2017/06/23/vremya-istekaet-glava-roskomnadzora-prigrozil-durovu-blokirovkoy-telegram) that soon it will block the Telegram messenger
- The Russian parliament is promoting a [law](https://meduza.io/news/2017/06/22/komitet-gosdumy-odobril-zakonoproekt-o-zaprete-anonimayzerov-i-vpn) which prohibits VPNs that refuse to cooperate with the government (maybe they will also try to block the Tor too)

#### Why Google was blocked:
1. People in the government found in the Google a site, which they found illegal.
2. They copied  a link to the site.
3. There are no direct links to the sites on the search page, there are long links like `https://www.google.ru/url?sa=0ahUKEwik-bla-bla`, which are redirected to the desired site.
4. But they did not know about this and... they blacklisted the **long** link.
5. Due to the fact that Google works only on HTTPS, the whole Google has been blocked all over Russia.

FACEPALM.
Aww, yeah! :D (my old HDD has 300 GB)
The Russian government launched a major campaign to discredit Telegram, any encryption and deep web. They show on TV news issues that equate encryption with terrorism and drug trafficking.
Somehow it reminds me of tetris... :D

Bad news from Russia.
There are attacks on the election headquarters of the opposition leader Alexey Navalny. He plans to participate in the presidential elections in Russia, but the current government will not let him do it.
So, what do the police and the fans of Putin:
- break into headquarters
- crush and smash everything
- steal **hundreds of thousands of** agitation **newspapers**
- **beat up volunteers**
- they locked the volunteer inside and beat him (now he is in the hospital, the police forces doctors to hand him over to the police, he is kept without food and water for **12 hours**)
- And also, much more.
Links: [1](https://meduza.io/short/2017/07/06/podzhech-razgromit-iz-yat-razbit-uvolit-osnovnye-metody-borby-so-shtabami-navalnogo), [2](https://meduza.io/feature/2017/07/06/vidimo-uzhe-bukva-n-i-tsifra-2018-eto-oskorblenie-nashey-vlasti), [3](https://meduza.io/feature/2017/07/06/shtaby-navalnogo-obyskivayut-v-poiskah-nezakonnoy-agitatsii-chto-s-etim-myagko-govorya-ne-tak), [4](https://zona.media/article/2017/06/28/zelenka), [5](https://meduza.io/live/2017/07/06/obyski-v-shtabah-alekseya-navalnogo-hronika)

Soon I will add a couple more photos to my gallery.

Now I have enough free time, but unfortunately I completely lost my inspiration and enthusiasm... The work on PocketMod as always goes extremely slowly, the themes for KDE Plasma and LXQt are not finished yet, the bot for cursors.io is also incomplete, some ideas about Arduino and Raspberry Pi have not been implemented...  D:

LOL, someone is spreading a [Zip-bomb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb) in ZeroNet. "Welcome" site contains an ~1 MB archive with a ~300 MB `index.html` page which is filled with zeros. It eats all available RAM, freezes the browser and later the entire computer (Firefox on openSUSE, 4 GB RAM).

Bad news from Russia: the law banning VPN and anonymizers is adopted, it will enter into force on the first of November. Links: [1](https://meduza.io/news/2017/07/21/prinyaty-zakony-o-messendzherah-i-zaprete-anonimayzerov), [2](https://rublacklist.net/30612/)
Given the plans of the Russian government to block VPN and Tor... Maybe one day they will get angry at ZeroNet and try to block the `127.0.0.1:43110`.
When I took apart the old DVD player, only I and God knew what I was doing. Now only God knows what I'm doing...

## Important!
The court transferred [Dmitry Bogatov](http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS/1491907362) from the detention center for house arrest! But the accusations were not dropped, he is still suspected of calling for riots due to the coincidence of IP addresses (he is the owner of the Tor exit-node).
Links: [1](https://rublacklist.net/30690/), [2](https://meduza.io/news/2017/07/24/matematika-bogatova-otpustili-pod-domashniy-arest-ego-obvinyayut-v-prizyvah-k-terrorizmu)

Check out the new design of the [PocketMod.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/pocketmod.bit) site.
I will publish a new beta version when I complete the auto-updates and fix some bugs of the Windows-build.

## O_o
Bad news from Russia: The activist was **fined for "propaganda of vegetarianism (!!!!)** and non-traditional orientation" on the Labor Day. This man was carrying a poster with the slogan "There is no need for any exploitation - become a vegan." Links: [1](https://meduza.io/news/2017/07/26/aktivista-oshtrafovali-za-propagandu-vegetarianstva-i-netraditsionnoy-orientatsii-na-pervomayskom-shestvii), [2](https://openrussia.org/notes/711980/)

Now I do everything in small parts, every day something different. For me changing of activity helps to keep enthusiasm. It seems that at the end of the summer I will suddenly post all my works at once. On the image - a small preview of my modification of the blog (I tried to combine 4 different screenshots - menu, list of posts, comments). Notable features:
- Open Sans Font
- Left column is removed
- But added a panel with links at the top
- Links can be edited in the browser (as in the left column)
- Small improvements for mobile devices
- Shadows (everywhere)

The IT textbook *(Информатика и ИКТ - Цветкова М.С., Великович Л.С., 2012.)* from my college **lies** about free software. Authors of the book state that *"the majority of developers of free programs prohibit to use their software for commercial production."*
It's a lie. The [GNU website](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.en.html) can explain why:
> “Free software” does not mean “noncommercial”. A free program must be available for commercial use, commercial development, and commercial distribution. You may have paid money to get copies of free software, or you may have obtained copies at no charge. But regardless of how you got your copies, you always have the freedom to copy and change the software, even to sell copies.

Check out my [customized ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1A5nKj7XV3SqU9CdAtpnYu7eqiaSHKcj9X). Need testers and seeders.

P. S. Nofish: sorry, I ruined your beautiful styles :D

Also I can recommend one excellent set of effects and overlays for kdenlive and a couple of excellent filters for GIMP. Also I can tell a little bit about the less popular, but sometimes useful free software.

But I still haven't abandoned the gallery with grass, PocketMod, a hellish machine from a DVD player and everything else. As I said earlier, I try to change the types of activities. I do everything a little.
Bad news from Russia: The Russian government plans to introduce a white list of permitted sites, and block all the others in 2020. [Link](https://geektimes.ru/post/291709/)

My [blog is back!](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit)

Transferring electric circuit from the Breadboard to PCB...
Part of the hellish machine from old DVD-player. Connecting wires at the bottom is a real hell xD

**Please note that this post contains my personal opinion, and I don't claim that it's absolutely correct**

*To the dispute about free licenses.* The best license doesn't exist. One license can not be definitely better than another. But here is a small story that illustrates what the copyleft protects from:

1. ["La Adelita"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Adelita) is a Mexican folk song from the times of the 1910-1917 revolution. Like the rest of folk art, this song is public domain.
2. The motif of this song was used in the Soviet film "Jolly Fellows" (1934). There is nothing wrong with this, it's legal.
3. The governmental organization "Russian copyright society" ("RAO") manages the rights to all creativity of citizens of Russia. **I blame it, it's wrong.** Third parties should not control the work of other people without their permission. This organization is extremely nasty.
4. "RAO" **orders** Internet sites **to delete the original song** "La Adelita" because it is used in Russian film. Many videos with this song have been removed from YouTube. RAO has no rights to this song, but now you can have problems with its use, although it is in the public domain.

[Link](http://www.antirao.ru/wiki/la-adelita-pesnya)

Copyleft guarantees that your work will always be free. And if someone improves the program made by people, then people should have the right to get these improvements back. Again: copyleft is not a panacea; it's not suitable in *all possible cases*. But do not consider it evil. 

> We can achieve much more if we stand together. We free software developers should support one another. By releasing libraries that are limited to free software only, we can help each other's free software packages outdo the proprietary counterparts. The whole free software movement will have more popularity, because free software as a whole will stack up better against the competition.
Nice and funny Dutch video about anti-corruption rallies in Russia - [YouTube link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6-os8xNMH5w) (turn on English\Russian subtitles)

First results of my [hellish printer](http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS/1500788224) that is made from the DVD player.

Oh, man... iPhone users should buy (!) the "song" with silence (!!) to "prevent" auto-play of first song in the playlist when the smartphone is connected to the music system in the car. Now they have 10 minutes to choose a song... Now this song is one of the most popular in the iTunes. Links: [1](https://twitter.com/i/moments/895392273810079744), [2](https://twitter.com/samir/status/895342239949496320), [3](https://geektimes.ru/post/291981/).
#### FACEPALM.

Bad news from Russia: The Russian government wants to gain control over crowdfunding. The requirements are quite strict, for example, the mandatory placement of servers and software in Russia. [Link](https://rublacklist.net/31126/)

# ATTENTION!

Do you remember the [arrest of the owner of the Tor output node](http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS/1491907362)?
Now it became known about the criminal case in Russia about **use of Tor** (not nodes, but **use of Tor Browser**). It's again about the coincidence of IP addresses - someone sent a false message about the upcoming terrorist attack, and now the police blame the random person because he used Tor at that time to circumvent censorship (apparently, the ISP provided connection logs). [Link](https://meduza.io/feature/2017/08/15/rossiyanin-stal-figurantom-ugolovnogo-dela-za-soobscheniya-o-teraktah-on-govorit-chto-prosto-zahodil-na-zablokirovannye-sayty-cherez-tor)

Guys, now it's **really dangerous** to use Tor and VPN in Russia. Now I will always connect via obfs4.
[New blog post](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:20:Orange+Pi+Zero) about Orange Pi Zero.

I'm still alive. In troubles, almost without free time and the opportunity to spend it as I want, but alive. *Stay tuned.*

Brief summary, if interested:
- My printer is too noisy and it irritates my father, so I don't have the opportunity to develop it further.
- PocketMod is in the complete stagnation, because my main computer doesn't belong to me and I don't have full access to it (I wrote in the blog how I program Arduino from Raspberry Pi)
- Some relatives criticize my hobbies and chosen specialty, so we are increasingly in conflict

Meanwhile: [WikiLeaks' Spy Files series](https://wikileaks.org/spyfiles/russia/) with releases about surveillance contractors in Russia.

Of course, the most interesting things happens when I'm offline. Especially it's about the long-awaited support for *large files*.

At the moment, my life can be described in one word - **stagnation**.

Most likely, tomorrow (5.11.17, about 9:00 AM UTC±0) I will be online here. **Incredibly** bad news from Russia are expected.

Bad news from Russia: the *"5.11.17"* protests (organized by V. Maltsev) are completely **failed**. At the moment about **400 are arrested**: [1](https://openrussia.org/notes/715720/), [2](https://meduza.io/news/2017/11/05/vyacheslav-maltsev-zayavil-o-zaderzhanii-100-svoih-storonnikov), [3](https://meduza.io/news/2017/11/05/politsiya-zaderzhala-bolee-230-chelovek-v-moskve-i-esche-pyati-gorodah-rossii) (about 300 arrested today [UPD, 3] and ~100 in days before the 5th [2]). For several years he promised great changes on this day, but nothing happened.
P.S. I'm just talking about the results (as neutral as possible).

Most detailed and actual [article](https://openrussia.org/notes/708374/) (in Russian). 
Someone under the name "Airat Bashirov" **used Tor** to post on the forum anti-government posts. In fact, there are about **hundreds** of IP addresses used by him, including, for example, Japanese or Dutch. But "comrade major" do not want to go abroad, right? By an unlucky coincidence he finds the address in Moscow where there is a **Tor exit-node**. So a lover of Esperanto, pacifist and vegetarian, absolutely random man now in the jail. At that time, when Dmitry was in court, Airat continued to write messages on the forum.

Incompetent Russian police believe that the IP is equal to identity and it is enough to blame the person that he has left that message. Idiots. Also, they found on his computer *a program called Tor* and said that Dimitry was using it to hide his identity.
There is no presumption of innocence in Russia.
[More fresh info](https://rublacklist.net/27509/)

For example, they condemn the demonstrations against corruption; they're making people think  that Dmitry Bogatov is a dangerous man, almost a terrorist; lying about the occupation of Crimea, calling it "voluntary" and more...

Merged-сайты (хабы) - по сути, это базы данных, которые каждый может склонировать (как и блог). А вот основной сайт (ZeroMe) - это как графический интерфейс к базам данных, что загружены локально. "GUI" при желании тоже можно склонировать и изменить. Вся фишка в том, что теперь можно не бояться "злого админа" - можно создать свой хаб, при этом не фрагментируя саму соц.сеть.

Пожалуйста, не надо делать ссылки вида `/site.bit`, ибо при использовании функции прокси (можно прописать `127.0.0.1:43110` как прокси, и ходить на сайты напрямую - `http://site.bit`) меня уносит в другую сторону - `http://me.zeronetwork.bit/site.bit`. Также уносит и других людей, использующих короткие адреса. А если делать длинные ссылки, то ZeroNet сам (!) видоизменяет адрес, чтобы я попал куда нужно.
И да, что-то не так с отступами в коде на статье. Либо лишние пробелы, либо высота строки такая, а может, так и задумано, конечно...
[More info](https://openrussia.org/notes/709871/)
I wrote the details of this case in [this post](http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS/1496363879)

Valid and verified HTTPS-cert (and no installed malicious third-party certs on your PC, this is important) means that your traffic to this site is encrypted, **but** it's much better to protect yourself with Tor\VPN\SSH-tunnel.
Yes, this is a very [serious vulnerability](https://meduza.io/news/2016/04/29/mts-otklyuchil-oppozitsioneram-sms-servis-vo-vremya-vzloma-ih-telegram).

@狗蛋: [This is because of server maintenance](https://twitter.com/btcecom)
@Jayofthezero: So, I'm evil too? Okay... :D
But invisible `save` and `cancel` buttons while editing profile description are still not fixed :(

@Kaffie: no, you **can**. It seems that you confuse the words ["proprietary"](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/categories.en.html#ProprietarySoftware) and ["commercial"](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/categories.en.html#commercialSoftware). The second is applicable to free software. Please, read these articles: [what is free software](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.en.html) and [selling free software](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/selling.en.html).

@Kaffie: It looks like you have not actually read it. Or read not to the end. These freedoms are applicable to both permissive and copyleft licenses. There is no specific condition for the distribution of source texts of **derived** programs. These freedoms indicate that the **developer decides** whether to prohibit making modifications to his program closed. And based on this decision, the developer chooses a license.
About paid programs - I'm more and more convinced that you have not read the articles. If the use of software requires a fee - this is not free software. It's about distribution. Also, there is the option of providing paid support.

> GPL... which restricts the sale of the software
@Kaffie: No. You absolutely don't want to read articles from people who created the definition of free software and the GPL. [Let's try again](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/selling.en.html)

@Kaffie: Copyleft helps to protect the free source code from becoming a proprietary one. You can use GPL-software for commercial purposes - retouch photos in GIMP for a fee, provide support and customization of software for money, even sell DVDs with distributions of GPL-software (for example, for those who do not have access to the Internet). It seems that you can't understand the difference between proprietary and commercial.

@Kaffie:
> A program is commercial if it is developed as a business activity. A commercial program can be free or nonfree, depending on its manner of distribution. Likewise, a program developed by a school or an individual can be free or nonfree, depending on its manner of distribution. The two questions — what sort of entity developed the program and what freedom its users have — are independent.

> Free commercial software is a contribution to our community, so we should encourage it. But people who think that “commercial” means “nonfree” will tend to think that the “free commercial” combination is self-contradictory, and dismiss the possibility. Let's be careful not to use the word “commercial” in that way.

> The term “sell software” is ambiguous. Strictly speaking, exchanging a copy of a free program for a sum of money is selling the program, and there is nothing wrong with doing that. However, people usually associate the term “selling software” with proprietary restrictions on the subsequent use of the software. You can be clear, and prevent confusion, by saying either “distributing copies of a program for a fee” or “imposing proprietary restrictions on the use of a program.”

> Software can be commercial and free at the same time by using a dual license. 
Another example is [Qt](https://www.qt.io/). This is a **commercial product**, available under the **[GPL, LGPL and paid license](https://www.qt.io/licensing-comparison/)**. If you pay them money, they will remove the GPL restrictions, it's simple. Understand at last that `commercial`, `free \ libre` and `copyleft` are compatible concepts.

@Kaffie: Here's a rough example (**very** rough) - imagine a constitution that allows murder. It is freer than the one that forbids. Does this constitution protect your right to life? You can give everyone permission to do anything, but are your freedoms protected?
Yes, BSD \ MIT \ Expat are more free in the meaning of "do whatever you want with my software, just leave an indication of my authorship". But the GPL allows you to impose such restrictions, so improvements and bug fixes of the program are returned to the community.
I'm not saying that those licenses are bad, not at all. They are really good in some cases.
And by the way, look at LPGL. With this license, the program can be embedded in proprietary programs, you only need to disclose the source codes of the part that is under this license.

I recommend to read the article [Why Copyleft](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/why-copyleft.en.html)
@Maxie: Russia will ban VPN services in November
@Maxie: eg Private VPNs, SSH tunnels

@Kaffie: Very good :)
But did you at least understand that the GPL does not conflict with the concept of free software and allows commercial use?
My personal opinion: the best license does not exist. It's like comparing a truck and a bus. The choice depends on the situation.

@Kaffie: [No](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.en.html#DoesTheGPLAllowMoney)
> Does the GPL allow me to sell copies of the program for money?
> 
> Yes, the GPL allows everyone to do this. The right to sell copies is part of the definition of free software. Except in one special situation, there is no limit on what price you can charge. (The one exception is the required written offer to provide source code that must accompany binary-only release.)
> - - - 
> Does the GPL allow me to charge a fee for downloading the program from my distribution site?
> Yes. You can charge any fee you wish for distributing a copy of the program. If you distribute binaries by download, you must provide “equivalent access” to download the source—therefore, the fee to download source may not be greater than the fee to download the binary.

@Kaffie: I can sale GPL soft. This is not restricted. Yes, I must provide the source code. But sale is allowed. Qt Company sells Qt. Red Hat and  SUSE sells GNU\Linux. Oracle sells MySQL. All this software is licensed under the GPL.
You not only ignore the text of the license and articles about it, but even practical examples of selling GPL software by well-known companies.
@Kaffie: And you can **use** Free \ Libre (including GPL licensed) software for **any** purposes, even commercial. Usage is not restricted at all.

> GPL will be a better choice, but you probably won't be very competitive in the business world.
